episodes.title: Episode 4: Building a Support System
episodes.description:
In this episode, Kyle, Shelley, and Ben dive into the importance of building a support network after leaving high-control groups like the Jehovah’s Witnesses. Topics include:

How to start creating a network from scratch after losing your previous community
The power of vulnerability and shared experiences in fostering genuine friendships
Practical tools like apps, meetups, and online communities for finding support
Resources for specialized support, including LGBTQ+ and youth-specific assistance
Insights into balancing quality over quantity when rebuilding your social circle
Special Mention: This episode highlights resources like Stonewall, Faith to Faithless, Mind, and Reddit's ex-Jehovah's Witnesses community as valuable starting points for those looking to connect and heal.

Trigger Warning: This episode contains discussions about trauma, shunning, and the challenges of rebuilding after leaving a high-control group. Listener discretion is advised.

episodes.title: Episode 3: Dealing with Trauma
episodes.description:
In this heartfelt two-part episode, Kyle, Shelley, and guest therapist Claire Alison Hams discuss the impact of trauma and its long-lasting effects on individuals who leave high-control groups like the Jehovah’s Witnesses. Topics include:

Understanding trauma and its manifestations (PTSD vs. CPTSD)
How trauma can affect physical and mental health
The role of therapy in recovery, including EMDR and other methods
Practical strategies for managing triggers and setting boundaries
Insights into recovery, healing, and building a healthier future
Trigger Warning: This episode contains discussions of trauma, mental health struggles, and emotional challenges. Listener discretion is advised.

A Note to Our Listeners: We apologize for the audio quality on Kyle's microphone in this episode due to unexpected technical difficulties. These issues have been resolved for future recordings, and we appreciate your understanding.

Additional Resources for Recovery:

Faith to Faithless: https://www.faithtofaithless.com
Freedom of Mind Resource Center: https://freedomofmind.com
Recovering from Religion: https://www.recoveringfromreligion.org
The Book: https://www.routledge.com/Walking-Free-from-the-Trauma-of-Coercive-Cultic-and-Spiritual-Abuse-A-Workbook-for-Recovery-and-Growth/Jenkinson/p/book/9781032305875?source=shoppingads&locale=en-USD&gad_source=4&gclid=Cj0KCQiAqL28BhCrARIsACYJvkcn8c7k-8aluhYK2g4DkIORJo6EjrZL66P3AongfB42NxMiM45j2FcaAnE9EALw_wcB

episodes.title: Episode 2: Leaving the Cult
episodes.description:
In this powerful second episode, we explore the deeply personal experiences of those who have left the Jehovah’s Witnesses. Join Kyle, Shelley, and guests as they discuss:

The emotional and psychological toll of leaving a high-control group.
Strategies for exiting, including navigating family relationships and community loss.
Heartfelt stories of resilience, healing, and rebuilding a life outside the organization.
Trigger Warning: This episode includes discussions of trauma, suicidal thoughts, sexual assault, family estrangement, and mental health struggles. Viewer discretion is strongly advised.

If you or someone you know is considering leaving a high-control group, or if you are dealing with the aftermath of such an experience, please reach out for support. Resources and support networks are linked below to help you on your journey.

Resources for those escaping:
r/exjw: A reddit supportive community for former Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Learn more: https://www.jwfacts.com
Faith to Faithless: https://www.faithtofaithless.com/

episodes.title: Episode 1: Understanding the Jehovah's Witnesses Cult
episodes.description:
In this debut episode, we dive deep into the origins of the Jehovah’s Witnesses, uncovering the historical roots of this high-control group and exploring its evolution into the organization it is today. Join Kyle and guest Ray as they discuss:

The founding of the Jehovah's Witnesses by Charles Taze Russell and its early influences.
Significant transformations under leaders like Joseph Rutherford.
The organization's unique doctrines, policies, and their lasting impact on members.
We also touch on the controversial practices of shunning, gender inequality, and their stance on blood transfusions. Whether you’re a current or former member, or simply curious about high-control groups, this episode offers valuable insights.

Resources for those escaping:
r/exjw: A reddit supportive community for former Jehovah’s Witnesses.
Learn more: https://www.jwfacts.com
Faith to Faithless: https://www.faithtofaithless.com/
